name: Zeus
lore: The supreme god of the Olympians, wielder of the thunderbolt and ruler of the skies.

passive.name: King of Olympus
passive.desc: All Greco-Roman allies gain +10% to all stats. All enemies suffer -10% Accuracy.

name: Hera
lore: Queen of the Gods and goddess of marriage, women, and family.

passive.name: Queen's Decree
passive.desc: All allies have a 20% chance to resist any debuff.

name: Gaea
lore: The personification of the Earth, one of the Greek primordial deities.

passive.name: Primordial Earth
passive.desc: All allies gain +50% DEF for the first turn of battle.

name: Ouranos
lore: The personification of the Sky, the primordial Greek god of the heavens.

passive.name: Primordial Sky
passive.desc: All allies gain +20% Dodge chance for the first turn.

name: Typhon
lore: The deadliest monster of Greek mythology, a monstrous serpentine giant.

passive.name: Father of Monsters
passive.desc: All C-tier allies gain +30% ATK.

name: Nyx
lore: The Greek primordial goddess of the night, a shadowy figure of exceptional power and beauty.

passive.name: Primordial Night
passive.desc: All enemies suffer -15% Accuracy for 3 turns at the start of battle.

name: Odin
lore: The All-Father of the Norse gods, who sacrificed an eye for cosmic knowledge.

passive.name: All-Father's Wisdom
passive.desc: All allies gain +10% Critical Hit Chance.

name: Fenrir
lore: A monstrous wolf, son of Loki, destined to slay Odin during Ragnarok.

passive.name: Unbound Fury
passive.desc: Gains +10% ATK for every 20% of max HP missing.

name: Jörmungandr
lore: The Midgard Serpent, a sea serpent so large it encircles the world.

passive.name: World Serpent
passive.desc: Applies Poison to all enemies for 3 turns at the start of battle.

name: Surtr
lore: A fire giant who wields a flaming sword and is destined to destroy Asgard.

passive.name: Scourge of Gods
passive.desc: Deals 30% bonus damage to S-tier enemies.

name: Yggdrasil
lore: An immense and central sacred tree, around which all else exists.

passive.name: The World Tree
passive.desc: All allies regenerate 5% of their max HP at the start of their turn.

name: The Norns
lore: Three female beings who rule the destiny of gods and men.

passive.name: Weavers of Fate
passive.desc: Applies a random powerful buff to one ally and a random debuff to one enemy at the start of battle.

name: Hades
lore: Ruler of the Underworld and lord of the dead, wielding power over wealth and souls.

passive.name: Helm of Invisibility
passive.desc: Has a 15% chance to dodge incoming Physical attacks.

name: Poseidon
lore: God of the sea, earthquakes, and storms, wielding the mighty trident.

passive.name: Earth Shaker
passive.desc: Attacks have a 15% chance to lower the target's DEF for 1 turn.

name: Ares
lore: The fearsome and often brutal Greek god of war and courage.

passive.name: Spirit of Battle
passive.desc: All allies gain +10% ATK for the first 3 turns.

name: Apollo
lore: God of music, arts, knowledge, and light. Known for his skill with the bow.

passive.name: Sun's Precision
passive.desc: Permanently increases own Critical Hit Chance by 10%.

name: Artemis
lore: Goddess of the hunt, the wilderness, and wild animals. A master archer.

passive.name: Huntress' Focus
passive.desc: Deals 20% more damage to enemies below 50% HP.

name: Hephaestus
lore: God of blacksmiths, metalworking, and fire. The divine craftsman of Olympus.

passive.name: Master Smith
passive.desc: Increases all stats of all allies by 5%.

name: Prometheus
lore: A Titan who stole fire from the gods and gave it to humanity.

passive.name: Giver of Fire
passive.desc: All Fire allies gain +15% ATK.

name: Atlas
lore: The Titan condemned to hold up the celestial heavens for eternity.

passive.name: Titan's Burden
passive.desc: Immune to Stun effects.

name: Cronus
lore: The leader of the first generation of Titans, who overthrew his father Ouranos.

passive.name: Titan King
passive.desc: Deals 25% bonus damage to S-tier Greco-Roman enemies.

name: Rhea
lore: The Titaness mother of the gods, and goddess of female fertility and motherhood.

passive.name: Mother of Gods
passive.desc: When an ally's HP drops below 25%, they receive a one-time heal for 30% of their max HP.

name: Scylla
lore: A legendary sea monster who haunted the rocks of a narrow strait.

passive.name: Six-Headed Horror
passive.desc: Attacks have a 40% chance to also hit a random secondary target for 30% damage.

name: Charybdis
lore: A sea monster, later rationalized as a whirlpool, who swallows and spews water.

passive.name: Whirlpool's Pull
passive.desc: At the start of its turn, has a 25% chance to lower the SPD of the fastest enemy by 20% for 1 turn.

name: Eris
lore: The Greek goddess of strife and discord, known for starting the Trojan War.

passive.name: Goddess of Discord
passive.desc: Attacks have a 30% chance to lower the target's ATK for 2 turns.

name: Thor
lore: The mighty God of Thunder, defender of Asgard and wielder of Mjolnir.

passive.name: Son of Odin
passive.desc: Deals 15% bonus damage to Guardian class enemies.

name: Loki
lore: The cunning trickster god, a shapeshifter who walks a fine line between ally and enemy.

passive.name: Master of Deceit
passive.desc: Has a 10% chance to dodge any incoming attack.

name: Freya
lore: Goddess of love, beauty, fertility, and war, who rides a chariot pulled by cats.

passive.name: Queen of Fólkvangr
passive.desc: At the end of her turn, heals the most injured ally for 10% of their max HP.

name: Frigg
lore: Odin's wife, the goddess of wisdom and foresight.

passive.name: Weaver of Fates
passive.desc: Reduces the duration of all negative status effects on all allies by 1 turn at the start of her turn.

name: Hel
lore: The goddess who presides over the underworld realm of the dead, Helheim.

passive.name: Queen of Helheim
passive.desc: Enemies defeated by this character cannot be revived.

name: Ymir
lore: The ancestor of all jötnar (giants), from whose body the world was created.

passive.name: Primordial Giant
passive.desc: All enemies suffer -10% SPD for 2 turns.

name: Jord
lore: The personification of the Earth in Norse mythology, and the mother of Thor.

passive.name: Personification of Earth
passive.desc: All allies take 20% reduced damage from Nature and Physical attacks.

name: Athena
lore: Goddess of wisdom, handicraft, and strategic warfare, born from the head of Zeus.

name: Hermes
lore: The swift-footed messenger of the gods, a patron of travelers and thieves.

name: Dionysus
lore: God of wine, festivity, and madness. His presence inspires ecstasy.

name: Achilles
lore: The greatest Greek warrior of the Trojan War, nearly invincible save for his heel.

name: Odysseus
lore: The clever king of Ithaca, famed for his ten-year journey home after the Trojan War.

name: Medusa
lore: A Gorgon with a gaze that could turn onlookers to stone.

name: Icarus
lore: The son of the master craftsman Daedalus, known for flying too close to the sun.

name: Theseus
lore: A mythical king and founder-hero of Athens, famed for slaying the Minotaur.

name: Orpheus
lore: A legendary musician and poet whose music could charm all living things.

name: Jason
lore: The leader of the Argonauts in their quest for the Golden Fleece.

name: Pan
lore: The god of the wild, shepherds and flocks, and rustic music.

name: Charon
lore: The ferryman of Hades who carries souls of the newly deceased across the river Styx.

name: Chiron
lore: A wise and just Centaur, known for his knowledge and skill in medicine.

name: Nemesis
lore: The goddess who enacts retribution against those who succumb to hubris.

name: Nike
lore: The goddess who personified victory, also known as the Winged Goddess.

name: Hecate
lore: A goddess associated with magic, witchcraft, the night, and ghosts.

name: Asclepius
lore: The Greek god of medicine, son of Apollo.

name: Morpheus
lore: The god of dreams, who can shape and appear in the dreams of mortals.

name: Hypnos
lore: The personification of sleep, the twin brother of Thanatos.

name: Thanatos
lore: The personification of peaceful death.

name: Heimdall
lore: The ever-vigilant guardian of the Bifröst bridge, who can see for a hundred leagues.

name: Tyr
lore: The one-handed god of law, justice, and heroic glory in Norse mythology.

name: Valkyrie
lore: A host of female figures who guide the souls of chosen warriors to Valhalla.

name: Skadi
lore: Norse goddess associated with bowhunting, skiing, winter, and mountains.

name: Baldur
lore: The beloved son of Odin and Frigg, known for his beauty and invulnerability.

name: Ullr
lore: A god associated with skiing, archery, and hunting.

name: Bragi
lore: The skaldic god of poetry in Norse mythology.

name: Vidar
lore: A son of Odin, destined to avenge his father's death by killing Fenrir.

name: Sif
lore: A goddess associated with earth and the wife of Thor, known for her golden hair.

name: Mimir
lore: A figure known for his knowledge and wisdom, beheaded and carried by Odin.

name: Forseti
lore: The god of justice and reconciliation in Norse mythology.

name: Idunn
lore: The goddess who possesses the apples of youth that grant the gods their immortality.

name: Centaur
lore: A creature with the upper body of a human and the lower body of a horse.

name: Satyr
lore: A troop of male companions of Dionysus with goat-like features.

name: Cyclops
lore: A member of a primordial race of giants, each with a single eye in the center of its forehead.

name: Minotaur
lore: A monstrous creature with the head of a bull and the body of a man.

name: Harpy
lore: A winged spirit known for stealing food and carrying evildoers to their punishment.

name: Siren
lore: Dangerous creatures who lured nearby sailors with their enchanting music.

name: Gorgon
lore: A monstrous female figure, Medusa was the most famous among them.

name: Nymph
lore: A minor female nature deity typically associated with a particular location or landform.

name: Dryad
lore: A tree nymph or tree spirit in Greek mythology.

name: Chimera
lore: A monstrous fire-breathing hybrid creature, composed of the parts of more than one animal.

name: Hydra
lore: A serpentine water monster with many heads that would regrow if severed.

name: Cerberus
lore: The multi-headed dog that guards the gates of the Underworld.

name: Griffin
lore: A legendary creature with the body of a lion and the head and wings of an eagle.

name: Pegasus
lore: A mythical winged divine horse, one of the most recognized creatures in Greek mythology.

name: Talos
lore: A giant automaton made of bronze, crafted by Hephaestus to protect Europa.

name: Echidna
lore: A monster, half-woman and half-snake, who became the mother of most Greek monsters.

name: Ladon
lore: The serpent-like dragon that guarded the golden apples in the Garden of the Hesperides.

name: Argus
lore: A hundred-eyed giant, whose eyes were transplanted to the peacock's tail.

name: Sphinx
lore: A mythical creature with the head of a human and the body of a lion.

name: Hecatoncheires
lore: Giants of incredible strength and ferocity, with one hundred hands and fifty heads.

name: Triton
lore: A Greek god of the sea, the son of Poseidon and Amphitrite.

name: Hippocampus
lore: A mythological creature shared by Phoenician, Greek, and Etruscan mythologies.

name: Empusa
lore: A demigoddess of Greek mythology, known for seducing men before eating them.

name: Laelaps
lore: A Greek mythological dog that always caught its prey.

name: Draugr
lore: An undead creature from Norse mythology that guards its burial mound.

name: Frost Giant
lore: A giant from Jötunheimr, born of the primordial ice of Niflheim.

name: Fire Giant
lore: A giant from Muspelheim, the realm of fire.

name: Troll
lore: A class of being in Norse mythology, often depicted as slow and dim-witted.

name: Light Elf
lore: Fair creatures who live in Alfheim, the realm of the elves.

name: Dark Elf
lore: Also known as Dvergar (dwarves), master smiths who dwell underground.

name: Dwarf
lore: Beings associated with mountains, wisdom, and smithing.

name: Einherjar
lore: The spirits of glorious warriors who feast in Valhalla, awaiting Ragnarok.

name: Sleipnir
lore: Odin's eight-legged horse, the swiftest of all horses.

name: Huginn
lore: One of Odin's two ravens, who flies across the world to bring him information.

name: Muninn
lore: One of Odin's two ravens, who flies across the world to bring him information.

name: Níðhöggr
lore: A dragon who gnaws at a root of the world tree, Yggdrasil.

name: Jötunn
lore: A member of the race of giants in Norse mythology.

name: Geri
lore: One of Odin's two wolves, to whom he gives all his food in Valhalla.

name: Freki
lore: One of Odin's two wolves, a companion to Geri.

name: Tanngrisnir
lore: One of the two goats that pull Thor's chariot.

name: Tanngnjóstr
lore: One of the two goats that pull Thor's chariot.

name: Ratatoskr
lore: A squirrel who runs up and down the world tree Yggdrasil, carrying messages.

name: Garmr
lore: A wolf or dog associated with both Hel and Ragnarök, described as a blood-stained guardian.

name: Fafnir
lore: A son of the dwarf king Hreidmar, who turned into a dragon out of greed.

name: Berserker
lore: Norse warriors who are reported to have fought in a trance-like fury.

name: Seidr
lore: A term for a type of sorcery practiced in Norse society during the Late Scandinavian Iron Age.

name: Vör
lore: A goddess associated with wisdom, so clever that nothing can be hidden from her.

name: Huldra
lore: A seductive forest creature found in Scandinavian folklore.

name: Erebus
lore: The primordial god of darkness, one of the first five beings in existence.

passive.name: Primordial Darkness
passive.desc: Reduces the damage dealt by all Light element enemies by 15%.

name: Tartarus
lore: The primordial deity of the deep abyss, a great pit in the depths of the underworld.

passive.name: The Pit
passive.desc: Attackers have a 50% chance to have their SPD lowered by 10% for 2 turns.

name: Pontus
lore: The primordial god of the sea, father of the fish and other sea creatures.

passive.name: Primordial Sea
passive.desc: All Water allies gain +15% DEF.

name: Oceanus
lore: The Titan god of the great, earth-encircling River Okeanos.

passive.name: World River
passive.desc: Heals all allies for 5% of their max HP at the end of his turn.

name: Hyperion
lore: The Titan god of heavenly light, one of the four pillars that hold the heavens.

passive.name: Titan of Light
passive.desc: Attacks have a 25% chance to lower the target's Accuracy for 2 turns.

name: Themis
lore: The Titaness of divine law and order, the personification of justice.

name: Mnemosyne
lore: The Titaness of memory and remembrance, mother of the Nine Muses.

name: Phoebe
lore: The Titaness of the 'bright' intellect and prophecy, grandmother of Apollo and Artemis.

name: Tethys
lore: The Titaness of the primal font of fresh water which nourishes the earth.

name: Crius
lore: A Titan associated with the heavenly constellations.

name: Coeus
lore: The Titan of intelligence and the inquisitive mind.

name: Iapetus
lore: The Titan of mortality, father of Atlas, Prometheus, and Epimetheus.

name: Perseus
lore: The legendary founder of Mycenae and slayer of Medusa.

name: Bellerophon
lore: The hero of Corinth who tamed the winged horse Pegasus and slew the Chimera.

name: Daedalus
lore: A skillful architect and craftsman, seen as a father of invention.

name: Stheno
lore: One of the three Gorgon sisters, known for her immense strength.

name: Euryale
lore: One of the three Gorgon sisters, known for her bellowing cries.

name: Automaton
lore: Magical, self-operating machines crafted by Hephaestus.

name: Colchian Dragon
lore: The ever-watchful dragon that guarded the Golden Fleece.

name: Angrboða
lore: A giantess, mate of Loki, and mother to Fenrir, Jörmungandr, and Hel.

passive.name: Mother of Monsters
passive.desc: All C-tier allies gain +30% HP.

name: Höðr
lore: The blind son of Odin, tricked by Loki into killing his brother Baldur.

name: Váli
lore: A son of Odin, conceived for the sole purpose of avenging Baldur's death.

name: Móði
lore: A son of Thor, whose name means 'Wrath' or 'Courage'.

name: Magni
lore: A son of Thor, whose name means 'Mighty' or 'Strong'.

name: Gullinbursti
lore: A boar with golden bristles, created by the dwarves Brokkr and Eitri.

name: Hraesvelgr
lore: A giant who takes the form of an eagle and sits at the end of the world.

name: Audhumbla
lore: A primeval cow from whom the giant Ymir fed.

name: Geri and Freki
lore: Odin's two wolves, who accompany him in battle.

name: Hati
lore: The wolf that chases Máni (the moon) across the night sky.

name: Sköll
lore: The wolf that chases Sól (the sun) across the sky.

name: Eos
lore: The Titaness goddess of the dawn, who rose each morning from her home at the edge of Oceanus.

name: Selene
lore: The Titaness goddess of the moon.

name: Helios
lore: The Titan god of the sun, who drove his fiery chariot across the sky.

name: Iris
lore: The personification of the rainbow and a messenger of the gods.

name: Boreas
lore: The Greek god of the cold north wind and the bringer of winter.

name: Zephyrus
lore: The Greek god of the west wind, the gentlest of the winds.

name: Notus
lore: The Greek god of the south wind, associated with the storms of late summer.

name: Eurus
lore: The Greek deity representing the unlucky east wind.

name: Styx
lore: A deity and a river that forms the boundary between Earth and the Underworld.

name: Lethe
lore: One of the five rivers of the underworld of Hades, associated with forgetfulness.

name: Nótt
lore: The personification of night in Norse mythology.

name: Dagr
lore: The personification of day in Norse mythology.

name: Heracles
lore: The most famous of Greek heroes, a divine hero of incredible strength, courage, and cunning who completed twelve impossible labors.

passive.name: Twelve Labors
passive.desc: Gains a stacking +15% ATK buff whenever any enemy is defeated (max 5 stacks).

name: Persephone
lore: Daughter of Zeus and Demeter, she is the Queen of the Underworld and the goddess of spring's bounty.

passive.name: Queen of the Underworld
passive.desc: The first time an ally would be defeated, they survive with 1 HP and become Invulnerable for 1 turn.

name: Hestia
lore: Goddess of the hearth, home, family, and the state. The firstborn of the Titans Cronus and Rhea, she is a gentle and peace-loving deity.

passive.name: Sacred Flame
passive.desc: All allies are immune to Burn and Freeze status effects.

name: Circe
lore: A powerful enchantress and minor goddess of magic, renowned for her vast knowledge of potions and herbs and her ability to transform foes into animals.

passive.name: Sorceress of Aeaea
passive.desc: Abilities have a 10% chance to Stun the target for 1 turn.

name: Hippolyta
lore: A queen of the Amazons, she possessed a magical girdle that was the object of one of Heracles' labors. A fierce and noble warrior.

name: Adonis
lore: A mortal youth of such incredible beauty that he was fought over by the goddesses Aphrodite and Persephone.

name: Sigurd
lore: A legendary hero of Norse mythology who slew the dragon Fafnir with his sword Gram, claiming its cursed treasure.

passive.name: Dragon Slayer
passive.desc: Deals 25% bonus damage to Guardian class enemies.

name: Brynhildr
lore: A powerful shieldmaiden and valkyrie who is a central figure in the saga of Sigurd, awakened by him from a magical sleep.

name: Grendel
lore: A monstrous creature descended from Cain, who terrorized the hall of the Danish king Hrothgar before being slain by Beowulf.

name: Beowulf
lore: A heroic warrior of the Geats who came to the aid of the Danish king, defeating the monster Grendel and his mother.

passive.name: Hero of the Geats
passive.desc: Gains +20% ATK and DEF if there is a Guardian class enemy on the field.

name: Astraeus
lore: Titan god of the stars and planets, and the art of astrology. Father of the four Anemoi (the Winds).

name: Pallas
lore: A Titan god of warcraft, a son of Crius and Eurybia, and a companion of the goddess Athena.

name: Perses
lore: Titan god of destruction. He was the father of Hecate, goddess of magic.

name: Melinoë
lore: A chthonic nymph and goddess, daughter of Persephone, who presided over nightmares and madness.

name: Zagreus
lore: A god of the Orphic mysteries, often identified with Dionysus, representing the cycle of life, death, and rebirth.

passive.name: Orphic Rebirth
passive.desc: The first time this character is defeated, they revive with 25% HP and a temporary speed boost.

name: Phobos
lore: The personification of fear and panic, a son of Ares and Aphrodite, who accompanied his father into battle.

name: Deimos
lore: The personification of terror and dread. He is the twin brother of Phobos and also a son of Ares.

name: Harmonia
lore: The immortal goddess of harmony and concord. Her necklace brought misfortune to all who possessed it.

name: Ganymede
lore: A divine hero from Troy, who was abducted by Zeus to serve as his cupbearer in Olympus.

name: Cassandra
lore: A princess of Troy cursed by Apollo to utter true prophecies that were never believed.

name: Penthesilea
lore: An Amazonian queen who fought in the Trojan War on the side of the Trojans.

name: Diomedes
lore: One of the most respected heroes of the Trojan War, he was even able to wound the gods Ares and Aphrodite.

name: Ajax the Great
lore: A Greek hero, son of Telamon, renowned for his immense strength and courage, second only to Achilles.

passive.name: Tower of the Achaeans
passive.desc: Applies Taunt to himself at the start of his turn.

name: Aeneas
lore: A Trojan hero who, after the fall of Troy, led his followers to Italy and became the mythical founder of Rome.

passive.name: Founder of Rome
passive.desc: All Greco-Roman allies gain +5% to all stats.

name: Camilla
lore: A swift and powerful warrior-maiden from Roman mythology who fought against Aeneas in Italy.

name: Janus
lore: Roman god of beginnings, gates, transitions, time, and endings. He is usually depicted with two faces.

passive.name: Two-Faced God
passive.desc: Allies gain +20% DEF on turn 1, and +20% ATK on turn 2.

name: Vesta
lore: Roman goddess of the hearth, home, and family, equivalent to the Greek Hestia. Her sacred fire was kept burning in her temple.

name: Lares
lore: Guardian deities in ancient Roman religion. Their function was to protect the household and family.

name: Lemures
lore: The vengeful and restless dead in Roman mythology, spirits of those who were not given a proper burial.

name: Kratos
lore: The divine personification of strength and power. A son of Pallas and Styx.

passive.name: God of Strength
passive.desc: This character's attacks cannot miss.

name: Bia
lore: The goddess of force and raw energy, the sister of Kratos.

name: Zelus
lore: The god of dedication, emulation, eager rivalry, envy, jealousy, and zeal.

name: Elli
lore: The personification of Old Age in Norse mythology, who, in one tale, managed to defeat Thor in a wrestling match.

passive.name: Personified Old Age
passive.desc: Any enemy that attacks this character has its ATK and SPD permanently lowered by 5%. This effect can stack.

name: Narfi
lore: A son of Loki. After his transformation into a wolf, his brother Váli killed him.

name: Hrungnir
lore: A jötunn (giant) from Jötunheimr, famous for his duel with Thor. He had a head and heart of stone.

name: Gríðr
lore: A female jötunn who assisted Thor by providing him with magical items to defeat the giant Geirröðr.

name: Gefjon
lore: A goddess associated with ploughing, prosperity, and virginity. Said to have plowed the land that became the Danish island of Zealand.

name: Sága
lore: A Norse goddess described as a seeress, possibly another name for Frigg, who dwelt by the stream of time.

name: Eir
lore: A goddess and valkyrie associated with medical skill and healing. Considered the best of all physicians.

passive.name: Merciful Healer
passive.desc: Increases all healing received by all allies by 20%.

name: Lofn
lore: A gentle goddess who arranges marriages, even when they have been forbidden.

name: Sjöfn
lore: A goddess who directs people's minds to love.

name: Ve
lore: One of the three brothers, including Odin and Vili, who slew the giant Ymir and created the world.

passive.name: Brother of Odin
passive.desc: Gains +15% to all stats if Odin is on the team.
